job_description: Quality Engineer I - Temporary - job post Bio-Rad Laboratories, Inc. 445 reviews Hercules, CA $45 an hour -  Temporary You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $45 an hour Job Type Temporary This role will spend approximately 50% of your time facilitating and updating legacy product risk management files to ensure compliance to internal quality management system, ISO 14971 and IVDR requirements. This includes meeting with cross functional subject matter experts to review and update current hazards, harms and probability of occurrence ratings. Reformatting existing system hazard analysis tables into current templates and electronic systems as needed. Updating and creating product risk management reports based on risk team conclusions and routing documents for final review and approval. The remaining time will be in supporting a variety of post market surveillance and IVDR preparation activities, including data collection, document retrieval and updates. This position is eligible for a hybrid schedule. How You'll Make An Impact: Working collaboratively with cross functional experts to ensure legacy product risk analysis files are up to date. Using knowledge of risk management process to ensure cross functional teams thoroughly assess risk management files. Using excellent organizational and time management skills to adequately update product documentation. Work with other QA personnel to support completion of IVDR and post market surveillance activities. Ability to work independently and prioritize several activities at once and escalate issues to management as needed. What You Bring: Previous knowledge of risk management (ISO 14971) and related risk management principles Bachelorâ€™s degree or equivalent in a related technical discipline 1-2 years experience or equivalent combination of education and experience Good organizational skills (ability to manage multiple projects/activities) Previous post market surveillance experience (complaints, CAPA) Good problem solving and critical thinking skills Understanding of working in regulated environment (ISO 13485, CFR 820, MDSAP, etc.) Compensation: The estimated hourly rate for this position is $45 at the time of posting. Actual compensation will be provided in writing at the time of offer, if applicable, and is based on several factors we believe fairly and accurately impact compensation, including geographic location, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities, and other job permitted factors. As a temporary associate, your employment will be managed directly through our approved agency provider. Who We Are: For 70 years, Bio-Rad has focused on advancing the discovery process and transforming the fields of science and healthcare. As one of the top five life science companies, we are a global leader in developing, manufacturing, and marketing a broad range of high-quality research and clinical diagnostic products. We help people everywhere live longer, healthier lives. Recently voted a Best Place to Work, Bio-Rad offers a unique employee experience with collaborative teams that span the globe. Here, you are supported by leadership to build your career and are empowered to drive change that makes an impact you can see. EEO Statement: Bio-Rad is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer, and we welcome candidates of all backgrounds. Veterans, people with disabilities, and people of all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, and orientations are encouraged to apply. Agency Non-Solicitation: Bio-Rad does not accept agency resumes, unless the agency has been authorized by a Bio-Rad Recruiting Representative. Please do not submit resumes unless authorized to do so. Bio-Rad will not pay for any fees related to unsolicited resumes
